title: Lower food and fuel prices drive inflation down to 3%
partialText: The rate at which prices are rising is slowing down, which could lead to lower interest rates.

title: 'Difficult' Russia-Ukraine peace talks end without breakthrough
partialText: The second day of negotiations between Ukraine and Russia ended after just two hours.

title: Children injured by NHS can claim damages for lifetime of lost earnings, court rules
partialText: The decision from the Supreme Court, on the case of a child who sustained a brain injury at birth in 2015, could have significant cost implications for the NHS.

title: Met making 'initial inquiries' into claims about Andrew protection officers
partialText: It comes after claims emerged that protection officers "turned a blind eye" during visits to Jeffrey Epstein's island.

title: Uefa investigates alleged racist abuse against Real Madrid player during Benfica match
partialText: Benfica claim there is a "defamation campaign" against Gianluca Prestianni as Uefa launch an investigation into claims he racially abused Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr.

title: GB medal hopes still alive after double win over US
partialText: Team GB's slim Winter Olympics curling medal hopes are still alive after both the men's and women's rink edge out the United States in Cortina.

title: Flooding may worsen as unsettled weather expected to last for at least another month
partialText: With wet and unsettled weather expected to continue flood affected areas will have to wait longer for any respite as Sarah Keith-Lucas explains.

title: Driver guilty over fatal smart motorway crash
partialText: Barry O'Sullivan killed 68-year-old Pulvinder Dhillon after driving into a stationary car on the M4.

title: Watch: Skier tells BBC of 'panic' as avalanche hit Italian slopes
partialText: Footage shows a queue of people, including children, covered in snow after an avalanche struck a valley in Courmayeur.

title: William says it has taken 'long time to understand my emotions'
partialText: Prince William has offered his advice to those struggling with their mental health, in a special Radio 1 panel discussion.

title: Plan to increase youth minimum wage could be delayed
partialText: Government sources tell BBC News they could slow down plans to make minimum wage equal across age groups.

title: 'How on earth have they done that?' - see Morrison's miracle shot that stole win for GB
partialText: Rebecca Morrison hit an incredible shot against the USA to win the game and give Team GB a chance of progressing into the curling semi-finals.

title: Watch: Lindsey Vonn shares her journey home after Olympics crash
partialText: The US skier was the Olympic downhill champion in 2010 and had been hoping for a fairytale ending to her illustrious career in 2026.

title: USA's Shiffrin wins slalom gold in emphatic style
partialText: American star Mikaela Shiffrin cemented her status as the greatest alpine skier of all time as she won Olympic slalom gold in emphatic fashion.

title: How a fatal crash happened on a smart motorway
partialText: Pulvinder Dhillon, 68, from London, died after the crash on the M4 in Berkshire in March 2022.

title: Under pressure from Trump, Venezuela's new president has aces up her sleeve
partialText: Delcy Rodriguez knows its in America's interests for her to be a success

title: 'Just push us into the sea': The frustration of a coastal community failed by political promises
partialText: In Horden, County Durham, Westminster slogans have long been left unmet as the population has plummeted.

title: I invested Â£12,000 in Brewdog  - I think I've lost it all
partialText: More than 200,000 people bought Equity for Punks shares in the craft brewer but many now believe they are worthless.

title: Cynthia Erivo ignores online criticism as Dracula gets mixed reviews
partialText: The Wicked star appears in a one-woman version of the classic horror story in London's West End.

title: All I could think about was death: Women from Syria's Alawite minority tell of kidnap and rape
partialText: The BBC hears harrowing accounts of assaults appearing to target the sect of former President Assad.

title: I used to hate my appearance. Here's how I learned to accept it
partialText: Tilly and Charlotte share their experiences of body dysmorphic disorder and how they recovered from it.

title: Climber on trial for leaving girlfriend to die on Austria's highest mountain
partialText: Kerstin G's boyfriend is accused of leaving her unprotected and exhausted close to the summit during a blizzard.

title: Wave of arrests over killing of French nationalist piles pressure on far left
partialText: Eleven people are in detention in connection with the killing of far-right student activist Quentin Deranque.

title: Rescuers search for nine missing skiers after California avalanche
partialText: Forecasters warn that heavy snowfall is likely to continue in the area over the next few days, making rescue efforts more difficult.

title: Defence giant BAE hails record sales as workers remain on strike
partialText: Defence company BAE has increased payouts to investors after its sales increased but staff in Lancashire have walked out over stalled pay talks

title: Ukraine officials to boycott Winter Paralympics
partialText: Ukraine officials will "not be present at the opening ceremony" or "take part in any other official Paralympic events" at next month's Winter Games following the inclusion of Russia and Belarus.

title: Palestine Action activists to face retrial
partialText: Deanna Heer KC says a retrial will be pursued on all charges which did not end in verdicts.

title: Otter cubs rescued after sheltering in car engine
partialText: The tired and cold cubs were taken in for the night by Karen Watson, who kept them in a cardboard box in her bathtub.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Is There A Gen Z Jobs Crisis?
partialText: Youth unemployment hits a more than 10 year high.

title: Why did US Attorney General lose her temper during Epstein Files questioning?
partialText: And did Barack Obama accidentally confirm the existence of aliens?

title: 'Defamation campaign' against Prestianni - Benfica
partialText: Benfica claim there is a "defamation campaign" against Gianluca Prestianni as Uefa launch an investigation into claims he racially abused Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr.

title: GB's curling medal hopes still alive after double win over US
partialText: Team GB's slim Winter Olympics curling medal hopes are still alive after both the men's and women's rink edge out the United States in Cortina.

title: Hamilton finds new F1 cars 'more fun' to drive
partialText: Lewis Hamilton says he finds the new Formula 1 cars this year "more fun" to drive - in contrast to the views of Max Verstappen and Fernando Alonso.

title: 'It smacks of England' - Australia fail again at T20 World Cup
partialText: Muddled selection and the lack of a plan B - how Australia's T20 World Cup campaign was derailed in Sri Lanka.

title: USA's Shiffrin wins slalom gold in emphatic style
partialText: American star Mikaela Shiffrin cemented her status as the greatest alpine skier of all time as she won Olympic slalom gold in emphatic fashion.

title: 'Scotland must buck trend to get into title mix with win in Wales'
partialText: Scotland have historically flopped in the game after beating England in the Six Nations - lock Scott Cummings says they are determined to put that right this year.
